Summary I’m a Senior UI / Front End Web Developer with deep knowledge of most the technologies used on the web. 
 
My background includes several years of web developing and problem solving, resulting in a strong understanding of the life cycle of a web application and how it works. 
I have an analytical mind, this allows me to quickly find the best and easiest way to approach and solve business problems. I've worked on several projects both as a front-end team leader and a developer utilizing the Agile / Scrum methodology. 
 
I also have a good knowledge about back-end technologies. 
 
My enthusiasm allows me to work under pressure and quickly solve technical challenges whilst always generating a clean, clear and reusable code when building high quality products. 
My experience includes several public facing web sites, using several cms and e-commerce platforms for high revenue projects.  
 
I always enjoy learning new technologies and keep myself updated. Summary I’m a Senior UI / Front End Web Developer with deep knowledge of most the technologies used on the web.

Software Developer NASA Ames Research Center 2006  –  2007  (1 year) Moffett Field, CA Contractor: Research Institute of Advanced Computer Science 
Duties: Responsible for developing front end Video Text Data Mining System (VTDMS) software that dynamically edits XML document content. The software parses a XML file that is the speech text of the video created by a software call Dragon Talk. VTDMS dynamically creates a webpage based on this XML. When the speech is being played, the words in the text are highlighted as the speaker enunciates them. Because the translation software has error in interpreting the human voice, the VTDMS has the capability to mask the accuracy of the words and it can also be edited in real time. When the reviewer selects a word in the text, the video will jump to the moment that the word is spoken. The changes made to the text in the video can be saved as a XML file in the server. 
Tools used: JavaScript, AJAX, DOM, XHTML, XML, CSS. 
Accomplishment: Integrated NASA Ames Research Center (Intelligent System Division) search engine 1.6 terabyte of video and making them searchable though XML file content.
